title: Blood Press. & Cholesterol | 2 of 2
question_text:
The two-way table above summarizes data about the occurrences of two medical measurements, blood pressure (BP) and cholesterol level, for $53$ individuals who were measured at the infirmary of a large steel mill as part of their annual check-up.
Which of the following Venn diagrams is an accurate display of the data if the circles represent normal blood pressure and normal cholesterol?
tables:
High BP (HBP)Normal BP (NBP)
High Cholesterol (HC)1311
Normal Cholesterol (NC)821

choices.text: None of the listed responses is correct.

solution:
The easiest way to see the correct solution is first to look at the “both” part of the Venn diagram.

In Choice 'D',
21
represents the number of individuals with both normal blood pressure and normal cholesterol, and the two-way chart shows that this is a correct value for that entry.

Now, look at the entire NBP circle, with two entries that give us
(
11
+
21
)
=
32
. This value again agrees with the two-way table because the total for all of those with normal blood pressure is
32
.

Next, look at the entire NC circle, with two values that give us
(
21
+
8
)
=
29
. Again, this total of
29
agrees with the two-way table’s total value for those with normal cholesterol readings.

Finally, the value of
13
for Neither should agree with the two-way table corresponding to those who have neither normal blood pressure nor normal cholesterol, which is
13
. In all of the other choices, at least, one of the entries in the Venn diagram does not agree with the two-way chart.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'D'.
